Sahay K K Birla Goa Computer Science & Information Systems Professor Applied Artificial Intelligence, Applied Cryptography, Blockchain Technology, Gravitational Wave, Information Security, Malware Analysis Department of Computer Science and Information Systems ssahay@goa.bits-pilani.ac.in 0832-2580243 https://in.linkedin.com/in/sanjay-k-sahay-15357150 Dr. Sanjay K. Sahay currently working as Professor in the Department of Computer Science and Information Systems. He is also a Visiting Associate of IUCAA, Pune. He has extensive research interests in Information Security, Applied Artificial Intelligence, Malware Analysis, Blockchain Technology, Applied Cryptography and Gravitational Waves. He has over hundred academic publications, and under his supervision, six students received PhD degrees. He successfully completed three sponsored projects and one project is under implementation. He has been a general co-chair of the International Conference on Information Security, Privacy & Digital Forensics, and the 8th International Conference on Secure Knowledge Management in the Artificial Intelligence Era. He has also been a member of the technical program committees of multiple conferences, advisors and session chairs for about 20 international conferences. He also serves as an editor of SKM-2019 & SKM-2021 proceedings, both published in the Communications in Computer and Information Science (Springer) and special issue of SKM-2019, published in the Information Systems Frontiers journal. He also published a book titled “Data Analysis of Gravitational Waves”. He teaches Blockchain Technology, Network Security, Cryptography, Computer Networks and Computer Programming courses. Before joining BITS, Pilani, he worked as a Postdoctoral Fellow at Tel Aviv University, Israel; Project Associate, Raman Research Institute, Bangalore and Project Scientist, IUCAA, Pune. In addition to teaching and research he has also held administrative roles viz. Faculty-in-Charge of Computer Centre, Hostel Warden, Department Research Committee, Department Committee on Academics and Library committee member.
